content.description: Monica, Chandler, and Phoebe’s, everyone is there and they are finishing watching the first episode of Mac and C.H.E.E.S.E. Joey is of course Mac.

content.speaker: Mac
content.text: Well, if we learned one thing today C.H.E.E.S.E. is that cheerleaders and high explosives don’t mix. (Cut to Joey laughing while Rachel, Chandler, and Monica aren’t amused.)

content.speaker: C.H.E.E.S.E
content.text: You can say that again Mac.

content.speaker: Mac
content.text: Well, I couldn’t have done it without you buddy. You’re a genius.

content.speaker: C.H.E.E.S.E
content.text: Oh yeah? Well then how come I can’t get my VCR to stop blinking 12:00?
(They both break into a huge laugh and do that stop-motion thing they had at the end of ChiPs.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: So, what did you guys think?
content.parenthetical: laughing and turning off the TV

content.text: (They all make happy faces as they are unable to express their feelings verbally. Finally, the phone rings and the race to answer it is won by Monica.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hello? (Listens) Hold on please. Joey, it’s your mom. (Hands him the phone.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: It’s your mommy. It’s your mommy.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Ohhhh…

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: That’s nice.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Mom, so what did you think? (He walks away allowing the gang a chance to figure out what they’re gonna say.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well that was umm…Okay.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: It wasn’t the best.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: That was one of the worse things ever. And not just on TV.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Wh-what are we gonna tell him?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well, the lighting was okay.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ohh no you don’t! You got lighting last time, lighting is mine!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: And I have costumes.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh great! That means I’m stuck with, “So, we were watching you in there (Points to the TV) and you were sittin’ right here! Whoa!”
(Phoebe gets up.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What are you gonna do Pheebs?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I don’t know. I don’t know. I can’t lie to him again. Oh no I—no! I’m just gonna press my breasts up against him.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: And say nothing?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Uh-huh, yeah that’s right.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Wow! Well, my folks really liked it! So what-what did you guys think? (Phoebe smiles, walks up to him, and presses her breasts against him.) It wasn’t that good.

content.description: Central Perk, Phoebe and Monica are reading on the couch.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Phoebe, do you think that your favorite animal says much about you?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: What? You mean behind my back?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh! Hi you guys, oh my God! You’ll never gonna believe what happened to me today! I am sitting in my office and…

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: You guys! You guys! You’re not gonna believe what my agent just told me!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Joey! Kinda in the middle of a story here!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Ooh, sorry. Sorry. You finish, go.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay, so anyway I’m sittin’ in my office and guess who walks in.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I’m gonna be on two TV shows!

content.speaker: Monica and Phoebe
content.text: Oh, that’s great!!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Joey!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh, you weren’t finished?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah! Guess who walks into my office is the end of my story. (To Monica and Phoebe) It was Ralph Lauren! (Monica and Phoebe gasp) Ralph Lauren walked into my office!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Uh Rach, if you’re gonna start another story, at least let me finish mine.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: It’s the same story.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Wow, it’s really long.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Anyway, Ralph just came in to tell me that he’s so happy with my work that he wants me to be the new merchandising manager for polo retail.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Still get a discount on wedding dresses?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I’m so happy for you!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well, these really are the days of our lives.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What?!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well, since you ask. They want me back on Days of Our Lives !

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh God!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I got—I get a big pay raise!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh hey!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I’ll be playing Drake Ramoray’s twin brother, Stryker!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oooh!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I get to hire my own assistant!

content.speaker: Monica and Phoebe
content.text: Ahhh!!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well—I got a head rush from standing up too fast right there.

content.description: Rachel’s New Office, she’s interviewing a potential new assistant, Hilda.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: And you were at this job for four years?

content.speaker: Hilda
content.text: That’s right.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay, well this is all very impressive Hilda, um I just have one last question for you. Uh, how did I do? Was this okay?

content.speaker: Hilda
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I’ve never interviewed anyone before. I’ve actually never had anyone work for me before. Although when I was a kid, we did have a maid, but this is-this isn’t the same thing.

content.speaker: Hilda
content.text: No dear. It’s not.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No. Yeah, and I know that. All right, well thank you so much for coming in, it was nice to meet you.

content.speaker: Hilda
content.text: Thank you! Good meeting you.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: All right. (Hilda exits) I’m a total pro!
(There’s a knock on the door and a handsome man enters.)

content.speaker: Man
content.text: Hello?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Wow! H-umm! Hi! Yes, uh I’m sorry the models are actually down the hall.

content.speaker: Man
content.text: Actually, I’m here about the assistant job.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Really?! (Taking his resume) Okay well then, all right, well just have a seat there. Umm, so what’s—what is—what’s your name?

content.speaker: Man
content.text: Tag Jones.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Uh-huh, go on.

content.speaker: Tag
content.text: That’s it. That’s my whole name.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: That’s your whole name, okay of course it is! Okay, well let’s-let’s just have a look-see here. (Looking at his resume)

content.speaker: Tag
content.text: I know I haven’t worked in an office before, and I really don’t have a lot of experience, but uh…

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh come on, what are you talking about? You’ve got three years painting houses. Two whole summers at T.G.I. Friday’s , come on!

content.speaker: Tag
content.text: It’s lame, I know. But I’m a goal-oriented person, very eager to learn…

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay, hold on just a second. (She grabs a camera out of the desk and takes his picture.) I’m sorry, it’s for human resources, everybody has to do it. Could you just stand up please?

content.description: Central Perk, Chandler is sitting on the couch when some unknown guy comes in and sits in their easy chair.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No-no-no-no. (Waves him away as Monica and Phoebe enter whispering to each other.) Hey! (Monica shushes him.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Anyway, I should go. Okay, bye.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey sweetie.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hi sweetie. So, what was with all the whispering?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I can’t tell you. It’s a secret.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Secret? Married people aren’t supposed to have secrets between one another. We have too much love and respect for one another.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Awww. (Kisses him.) But still no.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No I’m serious, we should tell each other every thing. I do not have any secrets from you.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Really? Okay, so why don’t you tell me what happened to Ross Junior year at Disneyland ?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh no-no, I can’t do that.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: If you tell me, I’ll tell you what Phoebe said.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: So, Ross and I are going to Disneyland and we stop at this restaurant for tacos. And when I say restaurant, I mean a guy, a hibachi, and the trunk of his car. So Ross has about 10 tacos. And anyway, we’re on Space Mountain and Ross starts to feel a little iffy.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh my God. He threw up?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No, he visited a little town south of throw up. (Monica laughs hysterically.) So what was Phoebe’s secret?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh, Nancy Thompson from Phoebe’s old massage place is getting fired.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: That’s it?! I gave up my Disneyland story for that?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: That’s right! You lose sucker!! (Pause) Please still marry me.

content.description: Monica, Chandler, and Phoebe’s, Chandler, Rachel, and Phoebe are there.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Chandler, you have an assistant right?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Did she call? You-you told her I was sick right? Always tell her I am sick!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No, I-I just don’t know how you decide who to hire. I mean I’ve got it narrowed down to two people. One of them has great references and a lot of experience and then there’s this guy…

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What about him?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I love him. He’s so pretty I wanna cry! I don’t know what to do. Tell me what to do.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Come on you know what to do! You hire the first one! You don’t hire an assistant because they’re cute, you hire them because they’re qualified.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Uh-huh. No, I hear what you’re saying and-and-and that makes a lot of sense but can I just say one more thing? (Takes out his picture.) Look how pretty!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Let’s see. (Looking at the picture) Oh my God! Oh… But no! No! You can’t-you can’t hire him, because that—it’s not professional. Umm, this is for me (The picture) yes? Thanks. (Puts it in her pocket.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay you’re right. I’ll hire Hilda tomorrow. Dumb old perfect for the job Hilda!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Let me see this guy. (Phoebe hands him the picture.) W-H-Wow! Don’t show this to Monica! And don’t tell her about the W-H-Wow!

content.description: [Scene: The Days of Our Lives producer’s office, Joey is entering to find Terry there.]

content.speaker: Terry
content.text: Hey-hey-hey Joey!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey Terry!

content.speaker: Terry
content.text: Good to see you again!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: It’s been a while, huh? Wow, it’s funny these halls look smaller than they used to.

content.speaker: Terry
content.text: It’s a different building.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: So! Stryker Ramoray huh? When do you want me to start?

content.speaker: Terry
content.text: Why don’t we start right now!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Okay.

content.speaker: Terry
content.text: Here are the audition scenes. (Holds out the script.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Audition? I thought you were gonna offer me the part.
content.parenthetical: looking between the pages and him

content.speaker: Terry
content.text: Why would you think that?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well, I was Dr. Drake Ramoray, Stryker’s twin brother. I mean, who looks more me than me right?

content.speaker: Terry
content.text: Everybody has to audition.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Y’know Terry, I-I don’t really need to do this. I got my own cable TV series, (Pause) with a robot.

content.speaker: Terry
content.text: I’m sorry Joey that’s…that’s the way it is.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well. I guess you think you’re pretty special huh? Sittin’ up here in your fancy small hall building. Makin’ stars jump through hoops for ya, huh? Well y’know what? (Throws the script away) This is one star who’s hoop… This is a star that the hoop—this hoop— I was Dr. Drake Ramoray!

content.description: Rachel’s office, she’s there as Tag knocks on the door and enters carrying a plant.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hi! Tag. What are you doing here?

content.speaker: Tag
content.text: I just wanted to come by and thank you for not laughing in my face yesterday. And I noticed there aren’t any plants in your office so I wanted to bring you your first… (Notices her plant) There is a plant in your office.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Kinda.

content.speaker: Tag
content.text: Right. So I guess I shouldn’t put “good at noticing stuff” on my resume. (Sets the plant down on her desk.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh-ohh, thank you.

content.speaker: Tag
content.text: Anyway, I’m guessing you hired somebody.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well…

content.speaker: Tag
content.text: Gotcha. Thanks again for meeting with me. (Starts to leave.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: But I hired you!

content.speaker: Tag
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah! You-you got the job! You’re my new assistant!

content.speaker: Tag
content.text: I am?!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah!

content.speaker: Tag
content.text: I can’t believe it!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Me either. Umm, all right, first thing I need you to do is go downstairs and find a women named Hilda and tell her to go home.

content.description: Monica, Chandler, and Phoebe’s, Monica is setting the table for dinner as Chandler enters.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey! Good, you’re home!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh it’s always nicer to hear than, “Aw crap! You again!”

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey baby. (Kisses him.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I made you a surprise.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh yeah?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yeah, tacos! Ever since you told me that story I’ve had such a craving for them.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Did you not understand the story?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey! What’s up?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Ross!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh, nothin’ much. Just trying to figure out what I’m gonna do for dinner.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Huh.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey—Ooh! What’s-what’s that, dinner stuff? You making dinner?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No! (The oven dings.) Shhh!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What you got over there? Tacos?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No! No. They’re umm… They’re just uh…ground beef smileys. (Holding up one of the shells.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Uhh, those are tacos.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Excuse me Mr. Mexico.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Eh, either way I’ll pass. (Quietly to Chandler) I still can’t eat those. (Monica is getting something out of the fridge and starts laughing.) What’s so funny?!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I’m not laughing.
(Ross and Chandler move closer to her and she starts laughing again.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: You told her!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Nancy Thompson’s getting fired! (Monica slaps him on the shoulder.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Look, okay-okay I had food poisoning! It’s not like I chose to do it! It’s not like—It’s not like I said, “Umm, what would make this ride more fun?!”

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You’re right. I mean I’m sorry. Yeah, I shouldn’t be laughing. I should be laying down papers for you! (Runs off laughing which gets Chandler laughing.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: How could you tell her?!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I had to okay?! We’re getting married! Married couples can’t keep secrets from one another!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh really? Well I-I guess Monica should know about Atlantic City.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Du-ude!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What happened in Atlantic City?!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well, Chandler and I are in a bar…

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Did you not hear me say, “Du-ude?!”

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: And this girl is making eyes at Chandler, okay? So after awhile he-he goes over to her and uh, after a minute or two, I see them kissing. Now, I know what you’re thinking, Chandler’s not the type of guy who just goes to bars and makes out with girls, and you’re right, Chandler’s not the type of guy who just goes to bars and makes out with…girls.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You kissed a guy?!! Oh my God.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: In my defense, it was dark and he was a very pretty guy.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh Mon, I laughed so hard…

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Ho-ho, so hard we had to throw out your underwear again?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Whatever dude, you kissed a guy.

content.description: Joey and Rachel’s, Phoebe is giving Joey a massage as Rachel enters.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hi!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey—Ooh, how’s Hilda? Is she working out?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ohh, my new assistant is working out, yes.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Was she happy you gave her the job?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, my-my new assistant was very happy that I hired my new assistant.
(The phone rings and Joey answers it.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hello? (Listens) Oh hey! Can you, can you hang on a second? (To Phoebe and Rachel) It’s the producers over at Mac and C.H.E.E.S.E. can you excuse me for a minute? (On phone) Hey, funny you should call. I was just looking over next week’s script. (Listens) Canceled?! (Listens) Like they’re taking it off the air? (Listens) Ohh. (Listens) All right, see you Monday. (Listens) We’re not even shootin’ them anymore?!! (Listens) All right, bye! (Hangs up) They canceled Mac and C.H.E.E.S.E!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Sorry.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I’m sorry Joey.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Why would they do that?! It was a good show right?!
(Phoebe and Rachel both pause, look at each other, and go press their breasts against him. Which Joey doesn’t mind, of course.)

content.description: Monica, Chandler, and Phoebe’s, Chandler, Monica, and Ross are still giving away all of their secrets.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You wanna tell secrets?! Okay! Okay! In college, Ross used to wear leg warmers!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: All right! All right! Chandler entered a Vanilla Ice look-a-like contest and won!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Ross came in fourth and cried!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh my God! (Laughing)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh, is that funny?! Oh, you-you find that funny?! Well maybe Chandler should know some of your secrets too!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I-I already told him everything! (Threateningly) You shush!!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Once Monica was sent to her room without dinner, so she ate the macaroni off a jewelry box she’d made.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Ross used to stay up every Saturday night to watch Golden Girls !

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Monica couldn’t tell time ‘til she was 13!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: It’s hard for some people!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Of course it is. (Mouths to Ross) Wow—whoa!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Chandler one time wore my underwear to work!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey!!!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Ohh, I’m sorry I couldn’t think of any more for Ross!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Ohh! Ohh! In college, Chandler got drunk and slept with the lady who cleaned our dorm!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: That was you!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Whatever dude, you kissed a guy.

content.description: Joey and Rachel’s, Joey is still bumming about cancellation of Mac and C.H.E.E.S.E.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: How could this happen to me?! Yesterday I had two TV shows! Today, I got nothin’!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well wait a minute, what happened to Days of Our Lives ?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Uh, well they might be a little mad at me over there.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: What happened?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well maybe I got a little upset and maybe I told them where they could go.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Joey, why would you do that?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Because they wanted me to audition!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: You! An actor?! That’s mad ness!

content.description: Rachel’s Outer Office, Tag is sitting at his desk as Rachel walks up. She stops and watches him pick up the phone.

content.speaker: Tag
content.text: Rachel Green’s office. (Hangs up.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Tag? (He turns and looks at her.) Hi, who was that?

content.speaker: Tag
content.text: Nobody. I was just practicing.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Really? (Giggles.)
(Phoebe rounds the corner.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hi!

content.speaker: Tag
content.text: Hi! Rachel Green’s office.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: You must be Hilda.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah, this is Tag. Tag, this is Phoebe. Phoebe, can I see you for a second? (Goes into office.)

content.speaker: Tag
content.text: Phoebe! That’s a great name.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, you like that? You should hear my phone number.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay. We’ll be right back. (They go into her office and she closes the door.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: So you hired yourself a little treat did ya?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: All right I know, I know how it looks Pheebs, but I’m telling you…

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: But-but you know you cannot get involved with your assistant.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yes, I know that. I know that. And I know that hiring him was probably not the smartest thing that I’ve ever done. But I’m telling you, from this moment on I swear this is strictly professional. (There’s a knock on the door.) Yes?
(Kathy enters (Because she’s listed in the credits).)

content.speaker: Kathy
content.text: Hey Rachel!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hi!

content.speaker: Kathy
content.text: Cute assistant! What’s his story? Is he…

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Gay? Yeah. (Kathy leaves dejectedly.)

content.description: Terry’s office, Joey has come to beg for a second chance.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey! Terry.

content.speaker: Terry
content.text: Joey Tribbiani! I’m surprised your big head could fit through our small halls! (Gets up) I gotta go Joey.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Wait! Terry! Wait—Look—Wait I-I… Look, I’m really sorry about before. I was an idiot thinking I’m too big to audition for you. You gotta give me another chance.

content.speaker: Terry
content.text: I can’t help you Joey.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Wait! Terry! Please! Look, I just lost my other job. Okay? You have no idea how much I need this. Please, help me out, for old times sake.
[Cut to a hospital room set on the Days of Our Lives stage. Two nurses are standing next to a bed with a man whose face is completely covered in bandages and reading his chart.]

content.speaker: Nurse #1
content.text: This poor guy’s been in a coma for five years. It’s hopeless.

content.speaker: Nurse #2
content.text: It’s not hopeless! Dr. Stryker Ramoray’s a miracle worker. Look, here he comes.
(Stryker enters, only it’s not Joey playing him.)

content.speaker: Dr. Stryker Ramoray
content.text: Good morning. (He walks over to the bed, leans down, and whispers to him.) Drake, it’s your brother Stryker. Can you hear me?

content.speaker: The Director
content.text: And cut!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I’m back baby! Ha-ha-ha!
content.parenthetical: jumping up and removing the bandages

content.description: Central Perk, Chandler, Monica, and Ross are sitting there and not talking to each other.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Y’know, in my defense, umm there was no glitter on the macaroni and very little glue.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: And in my defense, the cleaning lady came on to me!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You have no trouble telling time now right?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Quick! What time is it?! (Holds his watch in front of her face.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I don’t know! Time to kiss a guy maybe?! (Ross laughs.) What are you laughing at Pampers ? (He stops laughing and glares at her.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Y’know when I said that because we’re getting married that we should share everything and not have any secrets?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yeah?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah that was stupid. Let’s not do that.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Ohh, absolutely.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: And! We should keep all the stuff uh, we told each other secret from everybody else.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yeah, definitely!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay, (gets up) if you’ll excuse me, I-I’m gonna go hang out with some people who don’t know the Space Mountain story.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Then, I’d steer clear of Phoebe.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Man! (Monica mouths, “I’m sorry.”)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah, and not that you would, but I wouldn’t hang out with…all the guys in my office.
(Ross storms out.)

content.description: Rachel’s office, she’s looking at a picture of Tag when he knocks and enters.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hi! (Puts the pictures away.)

content.speaker: Tag
content.text: Do you have a minute?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well yeah, sure, what’s up?

content.speaker: Tag
content.text: I got asked out twice today when I was at lunch…by guys.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh really?!

content.speaker: Tag
content.text: Yeah. Did you tell someone that I was gay?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, did you not want people to know that?

content.speaker: Tag
content.text: But I’m not gay. And I especially wouldn’t want you to think I was gay.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Why’s that?

content.speaker: Tag
content.text: I don’t think I should say.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ohh, you can say. Come on, I don’t want you to feel like you can’t tell me things. (Motions for him to sit down.)

content.speaker: Tag
content.text: Okay.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: ‘Kay.

content.speaker: Tag
content.text: Well…

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Tag
content.text: I’d love to ask out your friend Phoebe.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah, she’s gay.
